conference_notes:
Coordination of humanitarian aid and distribution are important in such emergency situations where you need to know immediately what are the most affected areas and how to reach them. OpenStreetMap had a significant impact on crisis management. The updated maps of Haití helped the American Red to make quick decisions about where and how to send food and water to survivors. 
The OpenStreetMaps team was thanked by someone in the public, because of the help the mapping during a hurricane Matthew in Jamaica.
name: Open Mapping Mapathon
info:
Openstreetmap currently has 3.1 million registered contributors with over 4000 people editing the map every day. This platform is a collaborative project that allows you to create free maps of the world.

One example of using this platform is having collaborative maps of natural disasters, they are useful in earthquakes or hurricanes to improve the arrival of aid.

tweets.content: @HeatherLeson: Keen to build stuff? Us too! #iodc16 Join the Open mapping mapathon @1230 in Room F @openstreetmap @hotosm @Mapbox
